attributes.action: Prevent IDA from exhibiting satanic exhibits at Trafalgar Square on 19th April
attributes.additional_details:
April 19 is the first day of the 13-day Satanic ritual day relating to fire – the fire god, Baal, Molech/Nimrod (the Sun God), also known as the Roman god, Saturn (Satan/Devil). This day is a major human sacrifice day, demanding fire sacrifice with an emphasis on children. This day is one of the most important human sacrifice days and has had some very important historic events that occur this day.
All religions throughout the world will view this negatively which is why it must be stopped.
attributes.background: The Institute for Digital Archaeology is exhibiting The Temple of Baal at Trafalgar Square and Time Sq. New York commencing 19th April. The same day that the Blood Sacrifice to the beast begins.  Linked to satanic rituals and Satanism. It will send the wrong message to the world and needs stopping.

rejection.details:
Events in Trafalgar Square are the joint responsibility of the Greater London Authority and Westminster London Borough Council, and require approval by both organisations.

If you are unhappy with their decision to allow the IDA exhibition of a triumphal arch from Palmyra from 19 April in Trafalgar Square, you can petition the London Assembly (https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions) and Westminster Council (http://petitions.westminster.gov.uk/) about their decision.
